paper_abstract: A data-driven model for scheduling pumps in a wastewater treatment process is proposed. The objective is to minimize the cost of pump operations and maintenance. A neural network algorithm is applied to model performance of the pumps using the data collected at a municipal wastewater treatment plant. The discrete-state Markov process is utilized to develop a model of maintenance decisions. The developed pump performance and maintenance models are integrated into a scheduling model. A hierarchical particle swarm optimization algorithm is designed to solve the proposed scheduling model. The concepts developed in this paper are illustrated with two case studies. (C) 2015 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Data-driven minimization of pump operating and maintenance cost
